div.l: And whan þᵗat dronken was all in þᵉ crouke4158
To bedde went þᵉ douhter ryth anon̄
To bed goth Aleyn ⁊and also Iohn4160
Ther was no more hem neded no dwale
Þis myller hath so wysely by bed ale
Þat as an hors he fnorteth in his slepe
Ne of his tayle behynde he tok no kepe
His wyf bare hym a burdon wel strong4165
Men mythe hem here route aforlong
Þᵉ wenche routeth eke ꝑpar companye
Aleyn þᵉ clerk þat herde þis melodie
He polled Iohn ⁊and seyde slepest þᵘou
Herdest þᵘou eủer such a song or now4170
Lo such a coupelyng is be twyx hem alle
A wylde fyre on here bodyes falle
Who herd eủer such a ferly þing
Ȝe þey shall haue þᵉ floure of euell enyng
Þis longe nyth þ̉er tydeth me no rest4175
But ȝut no force all shall be for þᵉ best
For Iohn seyde he as eủer moste I þrife
Ȝif þat I may ȝonde wenche shall I swyf
Some esement god hath shapen vs
For Iohn þ̉er is alawe þᵗat seyth þus4180
Þat ȝif in oo poynt a mon be agreued
Þat in an oþ̉er he shall be releued
Oure corn is stolen sothly hit is no nay
And we haue had an yl fyt to day
And sythus I shal haue non amendement
Agaynes my losse I wyll haue myn esement
By godes saule hit shall non oþ̉er be4187
